--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Derek James" <djames@...> wrote:
>
> Yeah, I =
read about Cascade Correlation for the first time in a class
this
> semeste=
r.  It seems like a good early step in algorithms for
exploring good
> topo=
logies, but it's obviously far simpler and more limited than
something
> li=
ke NEAT.  As far as I understand it, you basically use multi-layer
> percep=
trons, train them with backprop, and when the learning
stagnates you
> add =
in another hidden node...rinse and repeat until you solve the
problem or
> =
reach diminishing returns.

There was something of a religious conflict abo=
ut a decade back
between the BackProp and CasCor sects of the multi-layer p=
erceptron
church. Like all such things it seems silly now (perhaps because
=
having moved on to NEAT I'm now apostate?).

My reservation with CasCor was=
 its potential weakness in generalising
in less well-bounded spaces. A majo=
r strength was less vulnerability
to being trapped local maxima, since each=
 training exemplar was fully
explored (potentially including adding a hidde=
n node) before moving
on. So CasCor networks were very good at recognising =
what they'd seen
before, but (I believed) needed caution when generalising.=
 So I was
more of a backprop guy.

Mike
